results.definition: continue a certain state, condition, or activity
examples: We continued to work into the night

results.definition: span an interval of distance, space or time
examples: The Archipelago continues for another 500 miles
`I know it's hard', he continued, `but there is no choice'

results.definition: keep or maintain in unaltered condition; cause to remain or last
continue in a place, position, or situation
examples: She continued as deputy mayor for another year

results.definition: do something repeatedly and showing no intention to stop
examples: We continued our research into the cause of the illness

results.definition: move ahead; travel onward in time or space
examples: She continued in the direction of the hills

results.definition: allow to remain in a place or position or maintain a property or feature
examples: We cannot continue several servants any longer
The demonstration continued after a break for lunch

results.definition: exist over a prolonged period of time
examples: The bad weather continued for two more weeks
